page.title: 14Manchester's Chinatown
page.content: A distinctive non-residential commercial and cultural sub-zone has been developed by people of Chinese origin in the last ten years. Its development reflects the increased immigration of people and capital largely from Hong Kong. The area, fringing the C.B.D., consists of a few hectares bounded by Princess,Portland,Mosely and Charlotte streets. Premises have been obtained on the lower floors of abandoned textile warehouses and are utilised by wholesalers, restaurants, suppliers of oriental artefacts, financial, cultural and consulate services. Street architecture has been modified by Chinese art and provides a backcloth for traditional festivals such as the Chinese New Year. A weekend school uses Shena Simon College.
